background: A vine company sells vine in vintage and regular bottles with different volumes, seeking to maximize the total number of bottles produced from a limited amount of vine while respecting a minimum ratio of regular to vintage bottles and ensuring a minimum production of vintage bottles.
constraints: Number of vintage bottles is non-negative
Number of regular bottles is non-negative
Number of regular bottles must be at least MinRegularVintageRatio times the number of vintage bottles
At least MinVintageBottles vintage bottles must be made
VintageVolume times number of vintage bottles plus RegularVolume times number of regular bottles must be less than or equal to TotalVolume
objective: Maximize the total number of bottles produced
description: A vine company sells vine in vintage and regular bottles. A vintage bottle can hold \param{VintageVolume} ml of vine while a regular bottle can hold \param{RegularVolume} ml of vine. The company has available \param{TotalVolume} ml of vine. Because vintage bottles are mostly bought by collectors, the number of regular bottles must be at least \param{MinRegularVintageRatio} times as much as the number of vintage bottles. However, at least \param{MinVintageBottles} vintage bottles must be made. How many of each should be made to maximize the total number of bottles produced?

parameters.definition: Volume of a vintage bottle of vine
Volume of a regular bottle of vine
Minimum ratio of regular bottles to vintage bottles
Minimum number of vintage bottles to be produced
